metadata.synopsis: Surgeon in the Cursed Town. In the ruins of a hospital, a twisted, monstrous surgeon - corrupted by the shadowcurse around him - is operating on a human strapped to a reclining chair. The operation is essentially torture, with the surgeon stripping away the human's senses (eyes, tongue have been removed), but the surgeon believes he's doing what he needs to to help his 'patient'.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter the cursed Town beside Moonrise. Enter the Hospital. Approach the surgeon in the operating theatre (large round room at the back.)

9.text: The objective of the scalpel, sisters, is to soothe, for the scalpel, indeed, is an extension of Shar.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon stand by a table upon which a wriggling human lies strapped down in an X position. Several Darkcloak sisters stand by, each with a scalpel in hand. The surgeon’s voice is very gentle - the voice of a father explaining something to his young child.

130.speaker: Malus Thorm
130.text: The objective of the scalpel, sisters, is to soothe, for the scalpel, indeed, is an extension of Shar.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The bewildered human thrashes against its restraints to no avail as the Surgeon speaks. He is holding his scalpel-like fingers high like a sacred object.

73.speaker: Malus Thorm
73.text: See how the patient reacts when I but stroke the right nerve. Hear its comfort. Hear the very melody of mercy.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Surgeon inserts his scalpel-finger into a nerve cluster in the human’s shoulder. Flesh parts and blood gushes. The screams of the human are so loud they nearly drown out the Surgeon’s words.

163.speaker: Malus Thorm
163.text: Pray, sister, show us the extent of your beneficence.
163.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) With his free hand he very gently invites one of the Darkcloak sisters to cut into the human.

165.text: Stop. Stay your hand, for it slaps where it should stroke. We can hardly hear the patient's sighs of solace.
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sister approaches - she looks uncertain of herself. She cuts into the human’s belly, but it’s a superficial and hesitant incision. The humann clenches its teeth and hisses in pain, but nothing like when the Surgeon applied his scalpel-finger.

144.speaker: Malus Thorm
144.text: Stop. Stay your hand, for it slaps where it should stroke. We can hardly hear the patient's sighs of solace.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Though the surgeon admonishes the Darkcloak sister, he does so in the same, gentle tone. There is no anger here, only paternal instruction. As he speaks, the Darkcloak sister bows her head in shame and takes a step back.

30.speaker: Malus Thorm
30.text: Perhaps it is our unexpected audience that makes you quiver.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Surgeon now looks straight at us, perfectly aware of our presence all this time. He points in our direction with his scalpel-finger and as he does so, all attending Darkcloak sister turn to us as well. It is a menacing sight.

141.speaker: Malus Thorm
141.text: Come. Step forward. You are no sister, but that matters none. Every student is welcome.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I don't wish to study, only to lift the curse on this land.

115.speaker: Malus Thorm
115.text: A curse? Nay, a cure that leads to the very pinnacle of being:

52.speaker: Player
52.text: A student, yes. Do please enlighten me.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: You will stop this sick spectacle at once.

82.speaker: Malus Thorm
82.text: Sick. Quite. But on the cusp of a cure:

176.speaker: Player
176.text: I am no student, I seek knowledge of the curse. It is a blight on this land.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I am a scholar, this is true - just not in the study of torture.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: What wrong has this man done to deserve such torture?

10.speaker: Player
10.text: In my experience, torture is usually more pain and less proselytising.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Just kill them already - all this torture is pointless.

168.speaker: Malus Thorm
168.text: Behold, sisters, the very face of ignorance - one who mistakes tenderness for torture.

114.speaker: Malus Thorm
114.text: Go on. Acquaint the face of ignorance with the true object of our studies.

133.speaker: Malus Thorm
133.text: Come. Step forward. I can see the love of Shar darken your eyes. Be welcome.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: May Shar guide your blessing hands.
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

48.speaker: Malus Thorm
48.text: And the rough vessels that are yours.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: What lesson are you teaching these sisters?
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

11.speaker: Malus Thorm
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

129.speaker: Malus Thorm
129.text: Tell me, what is the guiding principle of the goddess?
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

43.speaker: Player
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

136.speaker: Malus Thorm
136.text: I profess there is another more profound.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

84.speaker: Sister Hunna
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

135.speaker: Malus Thorm
135.text: Absence. No other word captures the heart of Shar so very perfectly.
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) On the words ‘pain’ and ‘peace’ he stabs the patient hard in each eye with his blade-finger, blinding it. It utters bloodcurdling screams.

55.speaker: Malus Thorm
55.text: It is the scalpel-led journey that leads from pain to peace.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) On the words ‘pain’ and ‘peace’ he stabs the patient hard in each eye with his blade-finger, blinding it. It utters bloodcurdling screams.

15.speaker: Malus Thorm
15.text: Only a beast of a man toys with his victim. Entertaining, if not efficient.
15.context: NodeContext: Agreeable, as if listening to sage wisdom

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: Only a beast of a man toys with his victim. Entertaining, if not efficient.
70.context: NodeContext: Agreeable, as if listening to sage wisdom

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: A stinging truth - but a truth nonetheless.
100.context: NodeContext: Agreeable, as if listening to sage wisdom

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: What the fuck is this loon talking about.
62.context: NodeContext: In mild wonder cause the thing she's reacting to is very outlandish.

95.speaker: Malus Thorm
95.text: See? What is the light of eyes but the cancer that causes one to witness the laceration of being?
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sisters all intone this line like a prayer as they raise their scalpels in our direction.

37.speaker: Malus Thorm
37.text: See? What is the light of eyes but the cancer that causes one to witness the laceration of being?
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sisters all intone this line like a prayer as they raise their scalpels in our direction.

17.speaker: Malus Thorm
17.text: If light is the symptom, then darkness is the cure, for in light there is presence, but in darkness there is absence.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sisters all intone this line like a prayer as they raise their scalpels in our direction.

47.speaker: Sister Hunna
47.text: In light is presence; in darkness, absence.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sisters all intone this line like a prayer as they raise their scalpels in our direction.

53.speaker: Malus Thorm
53.text: You are well on your way. But one white orb disfigures you still. Let us finish the cure.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) They are all poised to strike.

44.speaker: Malus Thorm
44.text: But you: look how the succour of Shar eludes you. See how painfully present you remain...

140.speaker: Malus Thorm
140.text: We do not wish to see you suffer so. Let us cure you.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Your subject is tainted. Shar's succour must only be granted to the willing.

94.speaker: Malus Thorm
94.text: Hmmm. 'Only the willing may know the Lady's embrace.' You know her teachings well.

71.speaker: Malus Thorm
71.text: And yet, these sisters must exercise their gifts, for the art of absence lies in its execution.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: The sisters require a willing volunteer, a master of the art.

79.speaker: Malus Thorm
79.text: And how gracious of you, master, to tender your own flesh.

25.text: And how gracious of you, master, to tender your own flesh.

85.speaker: Malus Thorm
85.text: And how gracious of you, master, to tender your own flesh.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: There is no greater joy than watching a master at work. You are their teacher - who better to volunteer?

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Their blades are uneven. Efficient surgery will require further training.
149.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a blade in one of the nurse's shaking hands. It is dull and somewhat rusted / caked with dried blood.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Examine the sisters and their implements.
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a blade in one of the nurse's shaking hands. It is dull and somewhat rusted / caked with dried blood.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *The sisters' blades are bloodied and dull. Only the most measured hand could make a clean incision.*
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a blade in one of the nurse's shaking hands. It is dull and somewhat rusted / caked with dried blood.

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *The sisters' blades are bloodied and dull. Only the most measured hand could make a clean incision.*
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a blade in one of the nurse's shaking hands. It is dull and somewhat rusted / caked with dried blood.

147.text: *You note nothing unusual about the sisters, aside from their menace.*
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a nearby sister. She remains still, oblivious to your inspection.

164.speaker: Narrator
164.text: *You note nothing unusual about the sisters, aside from their menace.*
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a nearby sister. She remains still, oblivious to your inspection.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Cast your gaze over the blades of the sisters.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *The sisters' blades are unkempt, rusted with blood. Even in your skilled hands, a clean cut would be difficult.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *The sisters' blades are unkempt, rusted with blood. Even in your skilled hands, a clean cut would be difficult.*

110.text: *Although you're well acquainted with most blades - implements of medicine aren't really your speciality.*

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *Although you're well acquainted with most blades - implements of medicine aren't really your speciality.*

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Recall what you know of Shar's teachings.
177.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Recall what you know of Shar's blasphemous teachings.
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: *You remember a Sharran maxim: 'Go forth and sow doubt, but do not compel it - for only the willing may know the Lady's embrace.'*

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *You remember a Sharran maxim: 'Go forth and sow doubt, but do not compel it - for only the willing may know the Lady's embrace.'*

121.text: *Try as you might, you can't think of any relevant teachings.*

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Try as you might, you can't think of any relevant teachings.*

64.speaker: Player
64.text: The sisters aren't ready. They'll make me sick instead of curing me.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

34.speaker: Malus Thorm
34.text: Hush. Fret not so. You are quite ready, aren't you, sisters?

162.text: Hush. Fret not so. You are quite ready, aren't you, sisters?

181.speaker: Malus Thorm
181.text: Hush. Fret not so. You are quite ready, aren't you, sisters?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: The goddess has greater plans for me than to submit to your scalpels.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

179.speaker: Malus Thorm
179.text: Another absence is your fate? But if you are not here to be cured, how will my sisters learn?
179.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

145.speaker: Malus Thorm
145.text: Another absence is your fate? But if you are not here to be cured, how will my sisters learn?
145.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

153.speaker: Malus Thorm
153.text: Their incisions are, as yet, still streaked with imprecision - that much I must concede.
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

68.speaker: Malus Thorm
68.text: How to steady their hands, I wonder.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I have read your treatise. Initiate the final lesson, or die by my hand.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

28.speaker: Malus Thorm
28.text: The final lesson. Yes. For to teach absence, one must become absent.

69.speaker: Malus Thorm
69.text: The final lesson. Yes. For to teach absence, one must become absent.

96.text: Oh, but the final lesson is hardly at hand. Would you deny my sisters the full breadth of my teachings?

139.speaker: Malus Thorm
139.text: Oh, but the final lesson is hardly at hand. Would you deny my sisters the full breadth of my teachings?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: 'Only with sacrifice is mastery gained.' For the sisters to learn, you must submit.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

124.speaker: Malus Thorm
124.text: Yes. Submit I must, into the Lady's dark-fingered embrace.
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

142.speaker: Malus Thorm
142.text: Yes. Submit I must, into the Lady's dark-fingered embrace.

72.text: I rather think your sacrifice will be quite masterful enough for our purposes.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

27.speaker: Malus Thorm
27.text: I rather think your sacrifice will be quite masterful enough for our purposes.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

103.speaker: Malus Thorm
103.text: Sisters. Speak the truth that I have taught you.
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Sparring is vital to progress. Have them practice on each other.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Practice - that's how I got good with a blade. They should spar each other.
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: In my years of study, I have found no better teacher than example. Perhaps you could volunteer?
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: When the fist trembles, sometimes another is needed to steady it. A good master would volunteer themselves.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I take joy in performing with a master of my craft - I'm sure the sisters are the same. Why don't you volunteer?
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: They need a better subject to practise on first. Not a student, but a master.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

117.speaker: Malus Thorm
117.text: I see now. By example I must edify and quell the light that blinds us.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

116.speaker: Malus Thorm
116.text: I see now. By example I must edify and quell the light that blinds us.
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

125.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

98.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) En masse, the sisters fall on the Surgeon like the senators on Caesar. They stab and keep stabbing the Surgeon with their scalpels until there’s nothing left but a bloody mess. After it’s over, the sisters stay in place to perform a Sharran prayer. They’ve no regard for us - we’ve dealt with the Surgeon without having to combat him.

88.speaker: Malus Thorm
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) En masse, the sisters fall on the Surgeon like the senators on Caesar. They stab and keep stabbing the Surgeon with their scalpels until there’s nothing left but a bloody mess. After it’s over, the sisters stay in place to perform a Sharran prayer. They’ve no regard for us - we’ve dealt with the Surgeon without having to combat him.

86.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) En masse, the sisters fall on the Surgeon like the senators on Caesar. They stab and keep stabbing the Surgeon with their scalpels until there’s nothing left but a bloody mess. After it’s over, the sisters stay in place to perform a Sharran prayer. They’ve no regard for us - we’ve dealt with the Surgeon without having to combat him.

109.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone these words together, then attack us.

36.speaker: Malus Thorm
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone these words together, then attack us.

122.speaker: Malus Thorm
122.text: What say you to the master, sisters?
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone these words together, then attack us.

60.speaker: Sister Hunna
60.text: The scalpel soothes. Come sing its song. We would hear your melody of mercy.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone these words together, then attack us.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Why not have them hone their skills on each other?
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon

2.speaker: Malus Thorm
2.text: Yes... For are we not all in need of a cure?
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon

0.speaker: Malus Thorm
0.text: Yes... For are we not all in need of a cure?
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon

148.speaker: Malus Thorm
148.text: The scalpel does not discriminate. Let each and every one of you partake in its soothing journey.
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon

57.speaker: Malus Thorm
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon

154.text: It is a proud moment when one sees one's teachings so lovingly taken to heart.
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Screaming and slashing, the sisters brutally murder each other.

113.speaker: Malus Thorm
113.text: It is a proud moment when one sees one's teachings so lovingly taken to heart.
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) He holds up his scalpel hand menacingly, clearly poised to strike at us.

33.speaker: Malus Thorm
33.text: You are to be commended for their graduation - rewarded with the promised cure.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) He holds up his scalpel hand menacingly, clearly poised to strike at us.

132.speaker: Malus Thorm
132.text: Come, I will acquaint you with the Lady's dark-fingered embrace.
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) He holds up his scalpel hand menacingly, clearly poised to strike at us.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I am not worthy! Please, show me how a master works - I would be honoured.
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You do me an honour, but I am not worthy. Show me the way of Shar - I beg of you.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I am but a fumbling squire before a master swordsman. Please, demonstrate so that I might learn.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: My magic has blinded me - I see now that Shar is the only path. Show me how - I beg of you.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I sought purpose in the natural world - I see now that Shar is the only path. Show me how - I beg of you.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I would rather acquaint myself - if you show me how.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

106.speaker: Malus Thorm
106.text: Your diligence is exemplary. Very well: your own scalpel you will be.
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

1.speaker: Malus Thorm
1.text: Your diligence is exemplary. Very well: your own scalpel you will be.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

38.speaker: Malus Thorm
38.text: Observe - then succeed me, into the succour of Shar.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

180.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

22.text: Oh but hush. Hold still. Let there be an end to your suffering.

146.speaker: Malus Thorm
146.text: Oh but hush. Hold still. Let there be an end to your suffering.

174.text: There is misdirection in your words. You seek to linger in your sickness.

6.speaker: Malus Thorm
6.text: There is misdirection in your words. You seek to linger in your sickness.

90.speaker: Malus Thorm
90.text: Sisters, what say we to such wretches?

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I suffer from boredom. The cure is ripping you apart.

65.text: How your sickness misdirects you! Blinded by luminous eyes. What say you to this, dear sisters?

75.speaker: Malus Thorm
75.text: How your sickness misdirects you! Blinded by luminous eyes. What say you to this, dear sisters?

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You are the cause of the only suffering here - I am duty-bound to end you.

49.speaker: Malus Thorm
49.text: But you: look how the succour of Shar eludes even you, one who walks faithfully in her shadow. See how painfully present you remain...

158.speaker: Astarion
158.text: He's just like Cazador - utterly insane.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: Hells. Only a monster would inflict misery and call it medicine.

126.speaker: Gale
126.text: Gods, what living nightmare is this?

171.speaker: Player
171.text: I confess I'm unfamiliar with the ritual you're practising.

151.speaker: Malus Thorm
151.text: I will make you intimately familiar.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You teach Shar's ways with grace, for such an... altered being.

131.speaker: Malus Thorm
131.text: Not altered, sister - elevated. Long have I basked in Shar's embrace. A vessel of her will I have become.
